abstract: The private equity owners of Edwards, the British engineering firm whose vacuum technology is used by the world’s biggest chipmakers, have hired a trio of investment banks to explore a $2 billion-plus sale or flotation, Reuters reported.
snippet: The private equity owners of Edwards, the British engineering firm whose vacuum technology is used by the world’s biggest chipmakers, have hired a trio of investment banks to explore a $2 billion-plus sale or flotation, Reuters reported.
lead_paragraph: The private equity owners of Edwards, the British engineering firm whose vacuum technology is used by the world’s biggest chipmakers, have hired a trio of investment banks to explore a $2 billion-plus sale or flotation, Reuters reported.

headline.main: Buyout Shops Said to Mull Move for Edwards
